title: Can the right education help in increasing efficiency in corporations? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are two educations - The textbooks syllabus and the parallel syllabus. Textbook education is not only about completing the syllabus and examining the journals of students. It has everything to do with the teacher’s character too. They might be excellent in their subjects but the parallel syllabus is missing. Students learn from their teachers' manners, language, generosity and discipline. Teaching is not only about lecturing students to do this and that, its grooming of subtle saplings into strong fruits giving trees. The parallel syllabus includes - Life skillsManaging personal financeBuilding relationsDeveloping traits like courage, generosityShopping and bargainingCommunication skillsTeamworkHelping parents in domestic choresMaking budgetsAnalytical skillsIf these chapters are included in schooling we can have efficient clerks, managers, sales team, PRs, executives in corporate.

I’m not certain where you can get an education in “efficiency”, at least in a university. Most university professors have very little knowledge about the day to day operations of a corporation, how to improve efficiency of those operations, or even how to define “efficiency”. In general, a university degree is a entrance card to the real education you receive on the job.

My take is that being in business successfully is about everyone there solving problems at some level, day in and day out. Solving problems are about learning to reason A curriculum that so focuses (contradistinct from social engineering to teach an individual to fit within a group) would increase productivity and the ability to enjoy life as well for everyone. Good luck to us all going into the future. Carver Wrightman alias Cecil R. Williams
Yes it can because right education would implicitly mean infusion of practical training along with conventional education hence it will increase efficiency .
